org.taverna.server.localworker.api

Class Constants

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.taverna.server.localworker.api.Constants

  • public abstract class Constants
extends Object
    The defaults associated with this worker, together with various other constants.
    Author:
    Donal Fellows

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CREDENTIAL_MANAGER_DIRECTORY
      Used to instruct the Taverna credential manager to use a non-default location for user credentials.
      static String CREDENTIAL_MANAGER_PASSWORD
      Used to instruct the Taverna credential manager to take its master password from standard input.
      static int DEATH_DELAY
      Time to wait during closing down this process.
      static int DEATH_TIME
      Time to wait for success or failure of a death-causing activity (i.e., sending a signal).
      static String DEFAULT_LISTENER_NAME
      The name of the standard listener, which is installed by default.
      static String HELIO_TOKEN_NAME
      Name of environment variable used to pass HELIO security tokens to workflows.
      static String KEYSTORE_FILE
      The name of the file that will be the created keystore.
      static char[] KEYSTORE_PASSWORD
      Password to use to encrypt security information.
      static String LOCALHOST
      The default hostname to require in secure mode.
      static String PASSWORD_FILE
      The name of the file that contains the password to unlock the keystore and truststore.
      static String RMI_HOST_PROP
      The Java property that holds the name of the host name to enforce.
      static String SEC_POLICY_PROP
      The Java property holding security policy info.
      static String SECURITY_DIR_NAME
      The name of the directory (in the home directory) where security settings will be written.
      static String SECURITY_POLICY_FILE
      The name of the file (in this code's resources) that provides the default security policy that we use.
      static String SHARED_DIR_PROP
      The name of the property describing where shared directories should be located.
      static int START_WAIT_TIME
      Time to wait for the subprocess to wait, in milliseconds.
      static String[] SUBDIR_LIST
      Subdirectories of the working directory to create by default.
      static String SYSTEM_ENCODING
      The name of the default encoding for characters on this machine.
      static String TIME 
      static String TRUSTSTORE_FILE
      The name of the file that will be the created truststore.
      static String UNSECURE_PROP
      The Java property to set to make this code not try to enforce security policy.

    • Field Detail

      • SUBDIR_LIST

        public static final String[] SUBDIR_LIST
        Subdirectories of the working directory to create by default.

      • SYSTEM_ENCODING

        public static final String SYSTEM_ENCODING
        The name of the default encoding for characters on this machine.

      • KEYSTORE_PASSWORD

        public static final char[] KEYSTORE_PASSWORD
        Password to use to encrypt security information. This default is <7 chars to work even without Unlimited Strength JCE.

      • SECURITY_DIR_NAME

        public static final String SECURITY_DIR_NAME
        The name of the directory (in the home directory) where security settings will be written.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEYSTORE_FILE

        public static final String KEYSTORE_FILE
        The name of the file that will be the created keystore.
        See Also:

        public static final String TRUSTSTORE_FILE
        The name of the file that will be the created truststore.
        See Also:

      • PASSWORD_FILE

        public static final String PASSWORD_FILE
        The name of the file that contains the password to unlock the keystore and truststore.
        See Also:

        The Java property that holds the name of the host name to enforce.

      • LOCALHOST

        public static final String LOCALHOST
        The default hostname to require in secure mode. This is the resolved version of "localhost".
